page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
Upminster is a{DORMITORY TOWN}20 miles east of Central London and at the eastern terminus of the District Line. As a commuter settlement Upminster's main line and underground station is a hive of activity during morning and evening rush hours.
Of great historic interest is the finely preserved{WINDMILL}set in a park off St.Mary's Lane and{TITHE BARN on Hall Lane.Both have open days for public viewing.
Upminster is a relatively prosperous town with a{POPULATION}of 26,000.Most live in low to medium density private housing estates of above average price.
Many commute to the City of London and others to Dagenham and Romford.
